risk_description: Mobile OS battery optimization strategies (iOS/Android) aggressively killing background location tracking processes required for 'Travel Mode', causing gaps in technician tracking data and SLA breaches.
root_cause: Native OS limitations on background execution to preserve battery life, conflicting with the requirement for <2s latency real-time tracking.
mitigation_strategy: Implement foreground service notifications for Android and 'Always Allow' location permission flows for iOS. utilize specialized libraries like `react-native-background-geolocation` that handle motion-detection state changes to reduce battery drain while maintaining accuracy.
contingency_plan: Implement 'heartbeat' logic where the backend sends silent push notifications to wake up the app if location data stops streaming during an active job.
monitoring_trigger: Gap in GPS coordinate timestamps exceeding 30 seconds for any technician in 'Travel Mode'.

risk_description: Data synchronization conflicts and data loss in the offline-first mobile architecture when reconciling local WatermelonDB/SQLite data with the backend after prolonged offline periods.
affected_tasks: WI-PROD-004 (Develop Offline Product List & Warranty Card)
root_cause: Complexity in bidirectional sync logic when multiple entities (e.g., technician and admin) modify the same service request state simultaneously.
mitigation_strategy: Implement 'Last-Write-Wins' strategy for simple fields and an append-only event log pattern for critical state changes. Design API endpoints to accept batched sync payloads with idempotency keys.
contingency_plan: Develop a conflict resolution UI on the mobile app to prompt the technician to manually resolve data discrepancies if auto-merge fails.
monitoring_trigger: Sync error rate exceeding 1% in Application Insights logs.

risk_description: Azure AD B2C custom policy complexity leading to token validation failures, session management issues, or inability to support required role-based claims for RBAC.
root_cause: Steep learning curve of Azure AD B2C Identity Experience Framework (IEF) and potential mismatch between B2C token structure and NestJS Passport strategy requirements.
mitigation_strategy: Conduct an immediate technical spike (PoC) to validate the end-to-end flow: B2C Custom Policy -> Token Issue -> React Native MSAL -> NestJS Passport Validation -> Role Extraction.
contingency_plan: Fallback to standard User Flows if Custom Policies prove too unstable, potentially sacrificing some UI customization or complex claim augmentation.
monitoring_trigger: Authentication failure rate > 5% during dev integration testing.

risk_description: Geospatial query performance degradation in PostgreSQL/PostGIS as the dataset grows, causing latency spikes in the Service Request Routing logic.
root_cause: Complex 'Point-in-Polygon' queries on unindexed or poorly indexed geometry columns combined with high concurrency during peak service request times.
mitigation_strategy: Implement rigorous spatial indexing (GiST) on geometry columns. Use read replicas for routing queries. Cache service center coverage polygons in Redis for rapid pre-filtering.
contingency_plan: Simplify routing logic to zip-code matching first, falling back to precise polygon matching only if zip codes are ambiguous.
monitoring_trigger: Database CPU usage > 70% or query execution time > 100ms for routing endpoints.

risk_description: Terraform state file corruption or locking issues in a team environment leading to infrastructure drift and deployment blockages.
root_cause: Multiple developers modifying infrastructure simultaneously without strict state locking mechanisms or modular separation.
mitigation_strategy: Enforce remote state storage in Azure Blob Storage with lease locking enabled. Implement Terraform automation strictly through CI/CD pipelines (Atlantis or GitHub Actions) rather than local execution.
contingency_plan: Maintain automated daily backups of the Terraform state file. Document manual state unlocking and recovery procedures.

risk_description: Inability to meet WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards for dynamic map interfaces and real-time chat components, leading to compliance violations.
root_cause: Inherent difficulty in making canvas-based maps and rapidly updating WebSocket content accessible to screen readers.
mitigation_strategy: Implement ARIA live regions for chat updates. Provide text-based alternatives/summaries for map data (e.g., 'Technician is 5 miles away'). engage accessibility consultant for audit.
contingency_plan: Develop a simplified, text-only 'Accessible Mode' view for critical tracking features if the map interface cannot be made compliant.

risk_description: GDPR compliance failure regarding 'Right to be Forgotten' due to immutable logs or backups containing PII.
root_cause: Storing PII in audit trails or immutable event logs which cannot be deleted selectively.
mitigation_strategy: Implement crypto-shredding: Store PII encrypted with a user-specific key; deleting the key effectively renders the data unreadable/deleted without altering the immutable log structure.
contingency_plan: Manual scrub scripts for database backups (high effort/risk).
monitoring_trigger: Security audit finding unencrypted PII in log streams.
